title: INTERSPEECH_2006_21_abs

sentences.text: In this paper , we discuss language model adaptation methods given a word list and a raw corpus .
In this situation , the general method is to segment the raw corpus automatically using a word list , correct the output sentences by hand , and build a model from the segmented corpus .
In this sentence-by-sentence error correction method , however , the annotator encounters grammatically complicated positions and this results in a decrease of productivity .
In this paper , we propose to concentrate on correcting the positions in which the words in the list appear by taking a word as a correction unit .
This method allows us to avoid these problems and go directly to capturing the statistical behavior of specific words in the application .
In the experiments , we used a variety of methods for preparing a segmented corpus and compared the language models by their speech recognition accuracies .
The results showed the advantages of our method .

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents language model adaptation methods that utilize a word list and a raw corpus, focusing on improving productivity in the segmentation and correction of the corpus for better speech recognition accuracy.

Entity-method.label: method
Entity-method.description: The method refers to a proposed approach for language model adaptation that focuses on correcting specific positions of words in a corpus using a word list, thereby improving productivity and capturing the statistical behavior of words.

Entity-general_method.label: general method
Entity-general_method.description: The 'general method' refers to a process for language model adaptation that involves automatically segmenting a raw corpus using a word list, manually correcting the output sentences, and constructing a model from the segmented corpus.

Entity-this_method.label: This method
Entity-this_method.description: This method refers to a language model adaptation technique that focuses on correcting specific positions of words in a corpus by treating each word as a correction unit, thereby improving productivity and capturing the statistical behavior of those words.

Entity-the_word_in_the_list.label: the words in the list
Entity-the_word_in_the_list.description: The words in the list refer to specific terms or vocabulary items that are utilized for segmenting a raw corpus in the context of language model adaptation methods discussed in the paper.

Entity-sentence-by-sentence_error_correc.label: sentence-by-sentence error correction method
Entity-sentence-by-sentence_error_correc.description: The sentence-by-sentence error correction method is a technique for correcting errors in segmented sentences during language model adaptation, which focuses on addressing grammatically complex positions to improve productivity by treating individual words as correction units.

Entity-a_word.label: a word
Entity-a_word.description: In the context of language model adaptation, 'a word' refers to a single unit of language that is used as a correction unit for improving the accuracy of speech recognition models by focusing on specific positions in a segmented corpus.

Entity-list.label: list
Entity-list.description: The 'list' refers to a collection of words used for language model adaptation and corpus segmentation in speech recognition tasks.

Entity-model.label: model
Entity-model.description: The 'model' refers to a statistical language model that is built from a segmented corpus derived from a raw text corpus and a specified word list, aimed at improving speech recognition accuracy.

Entity-word.label: words
Entity-word.description: In this context, 'words' refers to individual linguistic units from a specified word list that are used as correction units in the process of adapting language models for speech recognition.

Entity-correction_unit.label: correction unit
Entity-correction_unit.description: The term 'correction unit' refers to a specific word that is used as a focal point for error correction in the context of language model adaptation, allowing for targeted adjustments in the segmentation of a raw corpus.

Entity-advantage_of_our_method.label: advantages of our method
Entity-advantage_of_our_method.description: The phrase 'advantages of our method' refers to the benefits and improvements demonstrated by the proposed language model adaptation technique that focuses on correcting specific word positions in a segmented corpus, leading to enhanced speech recognition accuracy.

Entity-a_word_list.label: a word list
Entity-a_word_list.description: A word list refers to a curated collection of words used as a reference for segmenting a raw corpus and adapting language models in speech recognition tasks.

Entity-variety_of_method_for_preparing_a.label: variety of methods for preparing a segmented corpus
aliases: variety of methods for preparing a segmented corpus
Entity-variety_of_method_for_preparing_a.description: The entity 'variety of methods for preparing a segmented corpus' refers to different techniques employed in the process of segmenting a raw corpus into a structured format suitable for language model adaptation and evaluation, specifically aimed at enhancing speech recognition accuracy.

mentions.local_name: variety of methods for preparing a segmented corpus

Entity-productivity.label: productivity
Entity-productivity.description: In the context of language model adaptation, 'productivity' refers to the efficiency and effectiveness of the annotator's performance in correcting errors in a segmented corpus, which is negatively impacted by the complexity of grammatical structures encountered.

Entity-segmented_corpus.label: segmented corpus
Entity-segmented_corpus.description: A segmented corpus is a collection of text data that has been processed to divide it into meaningful units, such as words or phrases, often used for linguistic analysis or natural language processing tasks.

Entity-a_model.label: a model
Entity-a_model.description: a model refers to a statistical representation constructed from a segmented corpus, which is used in the context of language model adaptation for improving speech recognition accuracy.

Entity-language_model_adaptation_method.label: language model adaptation methods
Entity-language_model_adaptation_method.description: Language model adaptation methods are techniques used to modify or fine-tune language models to improve their performance on specific tasks or datasets.

Entity-output_sentence.label: output sentences
Entity-output_sentence.description: The term 'output sentences' refers to the sentences generated from a segmented corpus that require manual correction in the context of language model adaptation methods discussed in the paper.

Entity-the_annotator.label: the annotator
Entity-the_annotator.description: The annotator refers to the individual responsible for manually correcting errors in the output sentences generated from an automatically segmented corpus during the language model adaptation process.

Entity-these_problem.label: these problems
Entity-these_problem.description: These problems refer to the challenges and inefficiencies encountered by annotators when correcting grammatically complicated positions in a sentence-by-sentence error correction method during language model adaptation.

Entity-the_language_model.label: the language models
Entity-the_language_model.description: The language models refer to statistical models used in natural language processing that predict the probability of sequences of words, which are evaluated in this paper based on their performance in speech recognition tasks.

Entity-the_position.label: the positions
Entity-the_position.description: The positions refer to the specific grammatical locations within sentences where words from a given list appear, which are targeted for correction in the context of language model adaptation.

Entity-grammatically_complicated_positio.label: grammatically complicated positions
Entity-grammatically_complicated_positio.description: The term 'grammatically complicated positions' refers to challenging syntactic structures within sentences that hinder the efficiency of annotators during the manual correction process in language model adaptation.

Entity-a_decrease_of_productivity.label: a decrease of productivity
Entity-a_decrease_of_productivity.description: A decrease of productivity refers to the reduction in efficiency and output experienced by annotators when faced with grammatically complex sentence structures during the manual correction of segmented corpus data.

Entity-word_list.label: word list
Entity-word_list.description: A word list is a structured collection of words, often used as a resource for language processing tasks, linguistic analysis, or vocabulary building.

Entity-a_variety_of_method.label: a variety of methods
Entity-a_variety_of_method.description: A variety of methods refers to the different techniques employed in the experiments to prepare a segmented corpus for evaluating language models based on their speech recognition accuracies.

Entity-language_model.label: language models
Entity-language_model.description: Language models are computational systems designed to understand, generate, and predict human language by analyzing and processing textual data.

Entity-raw_corpus.label: raw corpus
Entity-raw_corpus.description: A raw corpus is a collection of unprocessed textual data used for linguistic analysis, natural language processing, or training machine learning models.

Entity-application.label: application
Entity-application.description: The term 'application' refers to the specific context of capturing the statistical behavior of words within a language model adaptation framework discussed in the paper.

Entity-statistical_behavior_of_specific_.label: statistical behavior of specific words
aliases: the statistical behavior of specific words
Entity-statistical_behavior_of_specific_.description: The statistical behavior of specific words refers to the patterns and frequencies of usage of particular words within a language model, which are analyzed to improve language processing tasks such as speech recognition.

mentions.local_name: the statistical behavior of specific words

Entity-error_correction_method.label: error correction method
Entity-error_correction_method.description: An error correction method is a systematic approach or technique used to identify and rectify mistakes in written or spoken language.

Entity-statistical_behavior.label: statistical behavior
Entity-statistical_behavior.description: The term 'statistical behavior' refers to the patterns and characteristics exhibited by specific words in a language model, particularly in the context of their usage and frequency within a given corpus.

Entity-the_application.label: the application
Entity-the_application.description: the application refers to the context or domain in which specific words are analyzed for their statistical behavior during language model adaptation in speech recognition tasks.

Entity-speech_recognition_accuracy.label: speech recognition accuracies
Entity-speech_recognition_accuracy.description: Speech recognition accuracies refer to the quantitative measures that evaluate the performance of speech recognition systems in correctly transcribing spoken language into text.

Entity-the_result.label: The results
Entity-the_result.description: The results refer to the findings from the experiments conducted in the study, which demonstrated the advantages of the proposed language model adaptation method over traditional approaches.

Entity-annotator.label: annotator
Entity-annotator.description: An annotator is a person who adds explanatory notes or comments to a text, often for the purpose of clarification or analysis.

Entity-result.label: results
Entity-result.description: Results refer to the findings or outcomes derived from a specific process or analysis.

Entity-experiment.label: experiments
Entity-experiment.description: Experiments are systematic investigations conducted to test hypotheses, evaluate methods, or explore phenomena, often involving controlled conditions and the collection of data.

Entity-paper.label: paper
Entity-paper.description: A paper is a written document that presents research findings, theories, or arguments, typically in an academic or scholarly context.

summary: In this paper , we discuss language model adaptation methods given a word list and a raw corpus . In this situation , the general method is to segment the raw corpus automatically using a word list , correct the output sentences by hand , and build a model from the segmented corpus . In this sentence-by-sentence error correction method , however , the annotator encounters grammatically complicated positions and this results in a decrease of productivity . In this paper , we propose to concentrate on correcting the positions in which the words in the list appear by taking a word as a correction unit . This method allows us to avoid these problems and go directly to capturing the statistical behavior of specific words in the application . In the experiments , we used a variety of methods for preparing a segmented corpus and compared the language models by their speech recognition accuracies . The results showed the advantages of our method .

Predicate-discusses.label: discusses
Predicate-discusses.description: The predicate 'discusses' indicates that the subject engages in a detailed examination or conversation about the object, providing insights, analysis, or commentary on the topic represented by the object. It implies an informative or explanatory relationship where the subject conveys information regarding the object.

Predicate-given.label: given
Predicate-given.description: The predicate 'given' establishes a relationship where the subject is provided with or is based on the object, indicating that the object serves as a foundational element, context, or condition for the subject's operation, understanding, or application.

Predicate-is_to_segment.label: is to segment
Predicate-is_to_segment.description: The predicate 'is to segment' indicates a relationship where the subject is intended or designed to perform the action of dividing or breaking down the object into smaller, manageable parts or segments. This action typically involves analyzing the object in order to enhance understanding, organization, or processing of the information contained within it.

Predicate-is_to_correct.label: is to correct
Predicate-is_to_correct.description: The predicate 'is to correct' indicates a purpose or function of the subject in relation to the object, suggesting that the subject is intended or designed to rectify, improve, or amend the object. In this context, it implies that the subject plays a role in ensuring the accuracy, clarity, or quality of the object.

Predicate-is_to_build.label: is to build
Predicate-is_to_build.description: The predicate 'is to build' indicates a purpose or intention associated with the subject, suggesting that the subject is engaged in the process of creating or constructing the object. It implies a forward-looking action where the subject aims to develop or establish the object, which is typically a tangible or conceptual entity.

Predicate-is_built_from.label: is built from
Predicate-is_built_from.description: The predicate 'is built from' indicates a foundational relationship where the subject is constructed or developed using the components or materials represented by the object. It implies that the object serves as a source or basis that contributes to the formation or creation of the subject.

Predicate-encounters.label: encounters
Predicate-encounters.description: The predicate 'encounters' signifies an interaction or meeting between the subject and the object, where the subject comes across or experiences the object in some context. This can imply a range of situations, from a casual meeting to a more complex or challenging interaction, depending on the nature of the object. The subject is typically an agent or entity that actively engages with or is faced by the object, which represents a concept, situation, or entity that may present some form of complexity, challenge, or significance.

Predicate-results_in.label: results in
Predicate-results_in.description: The predicate 'results in' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject is an action, process, or condition that leads to a specific outcome or effect represented by the object. It implies that the occurrence or implementation of the subject directly influences or contributes to the realization of the object.

Predicate-proposes_to_concentrate_on.label: proposes to concentrate on
Predicate-proposes_to_concentrate_on.description: The predicate 'proposes to concentrate on' indicates that the subject is suggesting a focus or emphasis on the object. It implies an intention or recommendation to direct attention, resources, or analysis towards the specified topic or area represented by the object. This connection highlights the subject's aim to explore, investigate, or elaborate on the object in a detailed manner.

Predicate-appear_in.label: appear in
Predicate-appear_in.description: The predicate 'appear in' indicates a relationship where the subject is present or can be found within the context or scope defined by the object. It suggests that the subject is included, located, or manifested in the specified object, highlighting a connection between the two entities.

Predicate-is_taken_as.label: is taken as
Predicate-is_taken_as.description: The predicate 'is taken as' indicates a relationship where the subject is perceived, interpreted, or regarded in a specific manner that aligns it with the object. It suggests that the subject is understood or classified in the context of the object, often implying a subjective or contextual interpretation rather than an objective fact.

Predicate-allows_to_avoid.label: allows to avoid
Predicate-allows_to_avoid.description: The predicate 'allows to avoid' indicates that the subject provides a means or capability to prevent or evade the occurrence of the object. It suggests that through the subject's implementation or use, the negative consequences or issues represented by the object can be circumvented or not experienced.

Predicate-captures.label: captures
Predicate-captures.description: The predicate 'captures' indicates that the subject effectively represents, conveys, or encapsulates the essence, characteristics, or details of the object, thereby establishing a relationship where the subject provides insight or understanding about the object.

Predicate-is_in.label: is in
Predicate-is_in.description: The predicate 'is in' establishes a relationship of inclusion or presence between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject exists within, is contained by, or is a part of the object. This connection suggests that the subject is relevant to or associated with the context or framework provided by the object.

Predicate-compared_by.label: compared by
Predicate-compared_by.description: The predicate 'compared by' indicates a relationship where the subject is evaluated or assessed in relation to the object. It suggests that the subject is being measured, analyzed, or judged based on the criteria or standards represented by the object. This comparison often involves examining similarities, differences, or performance metrics between the two entities.

Predicate-used_in.label: used in
Predicate-used_in.description: The predicate 'used in' indicates a functional relationship where the subject serves as a tool, method, or resource that is applied or utilized within the context of the object. It signifies that the subject contributes to, facilitates, or is integral to the processes, activities, or outcomes represented by the object.

Predicate-prepared_by.label: prepared by
Predicate-prepared_by.description: The predicate 'prepared by' indicates the relationship between a subject and an object where the subject is the result of a process or action that is executed using the object. It signifies that the object, typically a method, technique, or tool, is responsible for the preparation or creation of the subject, highlighting the dependency of the subject on the object for its formation or organization.

Predicate-showed.label: showed
Predicate-showed.description: The predicate 'showed' indicates a relationship where the subject presents, reveals, or demonstrates information, evidence, or characteristics that are encapsulated in the object. It implies that the subject provides clarity or insight into the object, allowing the audience to understand or recognize the significance of the object in relation to the subject.

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject is introducing, showcasing, or providing information about the object. It implies a formal or structured delivery of content, where the subject serves as the source or medium through which the object is conveyed to an audience.

Predicate-is_a_specific_instance_of.label: is a specific instance of
Predicate-is_a_specific_instance_of.description: The predicate 'is a specific instance of' establishes a relationship where the subject represents a particular example or case that falls under the broader category defined by the object. It indicates that the subject shares characteristics or properties with the object, thereby classifying the subject as a member of the group or type denoted by the object.

Predicate-improves_upon.label: improves upon
Predicate-improves_upon.description: The predicate 'improves upon' indicates a relationship where the subject offers enhancements, refinements, or advancements to the object. It suggests that the subject builds on the existing qualities or features of the object, resulting in a superior or more effective version. This relationship implies a comparative evaluation, where the subject is seen as a progression or upgrade relative to the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or subset that falls under the more general category represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the object encompasses a wider range of meanings or instances than the subject, thereby providing a context in which the subject can be understood as part of a larger conceptual framework.
